page.title: 02LANDSCAPE IN BALLINDALLOCH
page.content: Ballindalloch is beautiful.Though it flow the Rivers Avon and Spey from whose grassy valleys rise tree- and heather-clad hills. The River Avon (pronounced A'an) has waters so limpid that these words have been written: " The water o' A'an it rins sae clear 'Tw'ad beguile a man o'a hunder year." It joins the Spey in Ballindalloch, giving the name of our Parish "Inveravon" meaning "Confluence of the river".The River Spey, which is thought to derive its name from either 'spe'a Pictish word or 'speidh' a Gaelic word meaning rapidity, is the fastest-flowing river in Britain. Like the Avon, it is famous for salmon and trout, while its valley is known the world over for its distilleries producing fine whisky.
